content: मदः [मद्-अच्] {@--1@} Intoxication, drunkenness, inebriety; मदेतास्पृश्ये <ls>Dk.</ls>; मदविकाराणां दर्शकः <ls>K. 45</ls>; see comps. below. {@--2@} Madness, insanity. {@--3@} Ardent passion, wanton or lustful passion, lasciviousness, lust; इति मदमदनाभ्यां रागिणः स्पष्टरागान् <ls>Śi. 10. 91.</ls> {@--4@} Rut, ichor, or the juice that exudes from the temples of an elephant in rut; मदेन भाति कलभः प्रतपिन महीपतिः <ls>Chandr. 5. 45</ls>; so मदकलः, मदोन्मत, <ls>Me. 20</ls>, <ls>R. 2. 7</ls>; <ls n="R.">12. 102.</ls> {@--5@} Love, desire, ardour. {@--6@} Pride, arrogance, conceit; <ls>Pt. 1. 240.</ls> {@--7@} Rapture, excessive delight. {@--8@} Spirituous liquor. {@--9@} Honey. {@--10@} Musk. {@--11@} Semen virile. {@--12@} Soma. {@--13@} Any beautiful object. {@--14@} A river (नद). --दी {@--1@} A drinking-cup. {@--2@} Any agricultural implement (such as a plough &c.).
